answers.answer: Your endo sounds like my current one that I am firing!! Never mind checking you when you have the symptoms and it is swollen.....no....mine tells me to take tylenol arthritis to take the swelling down in my thyroid. Stupid! Find a new endo like me...I see my new one on 6/25. Don't waste time like me.
This just stinks doesn't it?  I just don't get why they would not want to see it when it is swollen.  No one has even given me a diagnosis.  How about you?

You think your endo sucks? Listen to this one...my endo works at "The Diabetes and Thyroid Institute of Fort Worth" and when I called today to tell them that I think my blood sugar is messed up he tells me to call my primary care physician because it has nothing to do with my thyroid. Hello???? Diabetes and Thyroid Institute?????  Am I missing something????
WOW - you got me there!  That is absurd!

Oh my Liz.....you have a dinkis doctor as well...LOLAnd no my doc hasnt told me why my thyroid swells and makes me cough and burn. He has never even run the hashi tests or anything. In fact he forgot to do my followup ultra sound on my new nodule from 8 mos ago. I have had 2 other nodules that dissolved after biopsy. Yes, the three of us have carnie doctors (carnival doctors) heheHeh Liz...I have been having bouts with hypoglycemia as well. Mine has been dipping down into the 50s. Did you get a glucose meter and start keeping track? I plan on bringing this up to my NEW doctor who despises carnie docs...haha

No, I haven't gotten a glucose meter. At my last bloodcheck a few weeks ago I was showing very low blood sugar 2 hours after eating but he didn't seem too concerned.  But I've noticed in the past few weeks I'm starting to feel shaky, lightheaded and a whole bunch of other things until I eat. Then it goes away for a bit and comes right back.  I called the endo today to see if I could get a fasting blood glucose test and that's when he told me to call my PCP.  SO, I'm going in tomorrow morning for a blood test and have an appt, in the afternoon. With my regular doctor because, you know...the DIABETES AND THYROID CENTER can't handle it!
Stupid doctors, they think just because the *specialize* the are GOD Almighty and we are lowly people.  I HATE THE DOCTORS (but would like one if they would just listen to me). :(

My glucose fasting test didn't show me at my lows. In fact some days it is fine and other days it dips into the 50's, that is why I got the meter to keep track on my own and to know the signs when my sugar level is low. I eat something every 2 1/2 hrs to 3 hrs now and make sure I consume plenty of protein. It has been much more stable since. Oh, I also started adding a glucerna drink late morning and that has made a big diff.  If I were you I would get one so your doc doesn't call you crazy with a normal fasting level  :)Let me know how your test came out!

First, I have seen every endo in my big city. One told me I was too complicated, one misdiagosed me with pneumonia even though I was a nurse educator and knew I hadpneumonia he told me I was a hypochondriac, one talked to his golf buddy during my appt and then charged me by the number of minutes he sat in the room. Another at a university prescribed Synthroid even though I explained I could not take it and when I did and almost died the office said they cold see me in two months. My current doctor  has given me an appt for 6 months even though I will run out of meds.  Hear is a news flash most endos do NOT care about thyroids and are not very well trained in this!!! MOST want diabetic patients because that is where the money is. My son has had diabetes for 21 years and even with good care is losing his sight. Doctors do suck but they really don't know very much about thyroids as it is a low level priority in med school. I really want to write a book about thyroid and patients with thyroid disease for doctors. I hope all of you will be up for stories when I finally get the energy.

question: LOL - I just got off the phone with the nurse after leaving a message this morning telling them that my goiter swells with exertion.  She called back a moment ago and said "it is very important for you to keep your appointment since you have one coming up on June 6", because the doctor will need to examine you then to see what is going on.  Nice, huh!
title: I think my endo sucks!
